item.title: Dane add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Dane add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dane add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dane add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Dane add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Dane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dane add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Dane add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dane add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Dane add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dane add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Dane add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Dane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dane add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Dane add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Dane add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dane add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "See the child." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dane add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Whatever in creation exists without my knowledge exists without my consent." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dane add a quote by Lawrence Clark Powell
item.description: "Write to be understood, speak to be heard, read to grow." -- Lawrence Clark Powell

item.title: Dane add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "These fragments I have shored against my ruins" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Dane add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Sticking feathers up your butt does not make you a chicken!" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Dane add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Dane add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Art is the child of nature in whom we trace the features of the mothers face." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Dane add a quote by Marc Riboud
item.description: "Taking pictures is savoring life intensely, every hundredth of a second." -- Marc Riboud

item.title: Dane add a quote by Nikolai Gogol
item.description: "Two turtle doves will show thee Where my cold ashes lie And sadly murmuring tell thee How in tears I did die" -- Nikolai Gogol

item.title: Dane add a quote by Richard Feynman
item.description: "There are 10^11 stars in the galaxy. That used to be a huge number. But it's only a hundred billion. It's less than the national deficit! We used to call them astronomical numbers. Now we should call them economical numbers." -- Richard Feynman

item.title: Dane add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The very existence of flamethrowers proves that sometime, somewhere, someone said to themselves, 'You know, I want to set those people over there on fire, but I’m just not close enough to get the job done." -- George Carlin

item.title: Dane add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A photographer is like a cod, which produces a million eggs in order that one may reach maturity." -- George Bernard Shaw
